title: (x) Warrior Athletic Dept. - Helvetica {Stephen}
content: I was wondering what this font is on the hooded sweatshirts at [http://www.stickle.com/crwarriorclothing/shirtspants.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20110812195134/http:/www.stickle.com/crwarriorclothing/shirtspants.php)
author: anonymous

comments.content: Oh, I'm also looking for something free. Thanks.

Wow! that sure wasn't hard at all, I'll try to find a little bit harder one next time ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110812195134im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
I don't suppose you know of anywhere where I could download it for free?

Wow! that sure wasn't hard at all, I'll try to find a little bit harder one next time ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110812195134im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
I don't suppose you know of anywhere where I could download it for free? Or even something close to it?

Wow! that sure wasn't hard at all, I'll try to find a little bit harder one next time ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110812195134im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
I don't suppose you know of anywhere where I could download it for free? Or even something close to it?

Actually, most computers come preinstalled with Helvetica,   
so I guess you must already have it. If not, use Arial (sorry   
Mark). You won't find Helvetica for free. Other obvious   
alternatives are Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk, Univers,   
Folio, Triumvirate, Bitstream's Swiss 721, Heldustry,   
House Industries' Chalet Sixty, ...
Most (all?) MAC computers do yeah - PC come along with Arial. Havent heard of PC
